result.execSummary:
The defendant Jared A Wheaton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV:  
[MK] case called at 9:58am.
Defendant Jared A Wheaton in court with Attorney David A Bolles.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count # 2.

On Count # 1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Wheaton on Probation for one year, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA treatment and counseling, and to follow through with recommended treatment as required by the Agent
--to cooperate with undergoing any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as required by the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety:  no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores except as necessary for work-related duties
--not to engage in any acts or threats of violence
--no violent contact with Angela Mulkey
--to comply with DNA sample provision unless previously provided 
--to pay costs of $243, plus the $100 domestic abuse, surcharge plus the $200 DNA surcharge= $543

Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess 10:18am.
Status conference on April 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 6, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[MK] case called at 11:18am. 
Defendant Jared A Wheaton in court.  ADA John Fryatt appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Wheaton verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to counsel given
Pleas of "not guilty" entered
The Court preserves the Defendant's right to request speedy trial for ten days; if not requested by then, the Court deems that speedy trial is waived by the Defendant

The Court continues the $150 Cash Bond (already posted), with added conditions: 
--no discussion of the case with Angela Mulkey 
--no acts or threats of violence toward anyone
--no possession of alcohol, except that Mr. Wheaton may possess alcohol for work-related purposes 
--no consumption of alcohol anywhere 
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores except for work 
recess 11:23am 


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 4/6/16 at 10:00am (2)  Status Conference on 4/29/16 at 10:00am
Bond posted on 2/21/16; received in COC on 2/22/16
